block.p: Anti-Defamation Dinner TOMORROW -- Elie Wiesel will speak at a black-tie dinner for the Anti-Defamation League at Cipriani 42nd Street. Cocktails begin at 6:30. Tickets, $1,500, from (212) 885-7747.

Lenox Hill Dinner-Dance TOMORROW -- The annual black-tie dinner dance to aid Lenox Hill Hospital will be held, starting with drinks at 6:30, at the Waldorf-Astoria. Tickets, $650, from (212) 434-2544.

For the Audubon Society TUESDAY -- A black-tie dinner at the American Museum of Natural History will support the National Audubon Society. The evening begins at 6:30 with cocktails. Tickets, $1,000, from (212) 245-6570, ext. 21.

Blues in Times Square TUESDAY -- Delbert McClinton will perform at a cocktail party and buffet dinner at Times Square Studios, 1500 Broadway (enter on 44th Street), that will raise money for the research programs of Joan's Legacy: The Joan Scarangello Foundation to Conquer Lung Cancer. The evening begins at 6:30 with cocktails and hors d'oeuvres. Tickets, $200, from (212) 627-5500.

For Social Services THURSDAY -- David N. Dinkins will be among those honored at a cocktail party at Mutual of America, 320 Park Avenue (50th Street), to aid the Human Services Council of New York City. The group promotes the interests of the city's nonprofit social service agencies. The party begins at 5:30 with drinks and hors d'oeuvres. Tickets, $125, from (212) 836-1230.

Aiding Children THURSDAY -- Edie Falco and Kyra Sedgwick will be among those reading stories about adoption at a cocktail party in a private home in the West Village to raise money for the Alliance for Children Foundation's program for the adoption of older children, siblings and children with special needs. The evening begins at 6 with drinks and tapas. Tickets, $175, from (781) 431-7148.

Shopping Bazaar THURSDAY -- A preview of the annual holiday shopping bazaar to aid the children's programs of the Lenox Hill Neighborhood House will be held at Sotheby's. The evening begins at 5 with drinks and hors d'oeuvres. Tickets, $300, or $125 for entry at 6, from (212) 744-5022, ext. 1355.

Down Syndrome Society THURSDAY -- A black-tie dinner at Bridgewaters, 11 Fulton Street, will aid the research, education and advocacy programs of the National Down Syndrome Society. Drinks begin at 6:30. Tickets, $500, from (800) 221-4602.

Netherlands Links FRIDAY -- The Netherland-America Foundation will benefit from a black-tie dinner at the Grand Hyatt. The evening begins at 7, with an after party beginning at 11:30. Tickets, $500, or $75 for the after party only, from (212) 355-6363.

Book Fair Preview FRIDAY -- Nine West Side restaurants will serve their signature dishes at a party and preview of the annual book fair at the Goddard Riverside Community Center, 593 Columbus Avenue (88th Street), to support the center's social service programs and. The evening begins at 6:30 with wine, the tastings and the book sale. Tickets, $125, from (212) 873-4448.,

Mellencamp at the Waldorf SATURDAY -- John Mellencamp will be among those performing, and Jimmy Kimmel will be the host of an evening of comedy, at the Waldorf-Astoria to raise money for the programs supported by the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research. The evening begins at 7 with drinks. Tickets, $2,500, from (212) 245-6570, ext. 20.

Concert for Leukemia NOV. 21 -- Tony Danza, Judy Collins and Jon Weber will be among those who performing at the annual concert at Carnegie Hall to aid the cancer research supported by the Lauri Strauss Leukemia Foundation. The performances begin at 7:30. Tickets, $100, from (212) 696-1033.
